### Government Tender Announcement: Caterpillar NISO for OEM Parts and Service 

#### Reference Number
 PW-__ML-066-29287, Amendment 1

#### Solicitation Number
 F7044-230751/A

#### Publication Date
 2024-02-26

#### Tender Closing Date
 2024-03-13T14:00:00

#### Amendment Date
 2024-02-28

#### Trade Agreement
 Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

#### Notice Overview
This Advanced Contract Award Notice (ACAN) announces the intention of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) to award a contract to Toromont Industries Ltd. for Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) certified parts and service for Caterpillar equipment used by Fisheries and Oceans Canada.

#### Background
Fisheries and Oceans Canada requires ongoing parts and service for Caterpillar equipment installed on its vessels in various regions across Canada. The selected vendor must provide OEM certified parts and service, as the equipment is subject to emission regulation requirements.

#### Statement of Capabilities
Suppliers who consider themselves qualified and available to provide the services described in this ACAN may submit a statement of capabilities in writing highlighting their experience, capacity, and credentials to meet the advertised requirements. The statement must demonstrate how the supplier meets the OEM certified parts and service requirements.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The following criteria will be used to evaluate statements of capabilities:
* Direct access to Caterpillar certified technicians
* Ability to provide Caterpillar OEM parts
* Access to Caterpillar technical bulletins and intellectual property
* Direct access to Caterpillar warranty procedures

#### Trade Agreement Exclusions
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), but is exempt from trade agreements due to the application of section 513, article b.iii, v, and vi, which allows for limited tendering due to technical reasons, compatibility with existing goods, and warranty provisions.

#### Contract Details
The proposed contract is for an initial period of one year, with options to extend for three additional one-year periods. The estimated value of the contract, including options, is $16,000,000.00, taxes included.
